title: User object in GraphQL exposes number of trial reports for External Programs that also have a Private Program

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**

For this vulnerability to work, it is necessary that you should be Admin/member of atleast one sandbox team and running a GraphQL node can tell you if the external programs exist on directory page running a private program on hackerone or not

`https://hackerone.com/directory?query=type%3Aexternal&sort=name%3Aascending&page=1`


**Description:**

 By running a below graphQL, it is possible to know wether external program running a private program or not

```
{"query":"query Report_submission_page{\n  query {\n    id,\n    ...F0\n  }\n}\nfragment F0 on Query {\n  me {\n    username,\n    _remaining_reports3zrc4S:remaining_reports(team_handle:\"█████\")\n  },\n  id\n}","variables":{"first_0":100}}
```

And the response will be 

```
{"data":{"query":{"id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL09iamVjdHM6OlF1ZXJ5L3N0YXRpYw==","me":{"username":"acc1","_remaining_reports3zrc4S":1}}}}
```


As you can see in response, `"_remaining_reports3zrc4S":1`

The response is always `1` for external programs if private program exist or else, it will be `null`

For eg i have verified that following program are running private program and i am getting response as 1

███████
██████████
████
██████

Where as following program gives me null

██████
███████
██████
████

Also, for some public programs like `Security` , i get `5` . I am not sure what this remaining report is about but it atleast helps you tell that if external program exist on h1 or not 


### Steps To Reproduce

1.  Register any sandbox program
2. Run above graphQL query
3.  If you get `"_remaining_reports3zrc4S":1`  in response, that means external program is running private program on hackerone
4. If you get `"_remaining_reports3zrc4S":null` , that means it doesn't exist on hackerone!


Regards,
Ashish

## Impact

Know wether external programs running private programs on hackerone or not

Summary:

For this vulnerability to work, it is necessary that you should be Admin/member of atleast one sandbox team and running a GraphQL node can tell you if the external programs exist on directory page running a private program on hackerone or not

https://hackerone.com/directory?query=type%3Aexternal&sort=name%3Aascending&page=1

Description:

By running a below graphQL, it is possible to know wether external program running a private program or not

{"query":"query Report_submission_page{\n  query {\n    id,\n    ...F0\n  }\n}\nfragment F0 on Query {\n  me {\n    username,\n    _remaining_reports3zrc4S:remaining_reports(team_handle:\"█████\")\n  },\n  id\n}","variables":{"first_0":100}}

And the response will be 

{"data":{"query":{"id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL09iamVjdHM6OlF1ZXJ5L3N0YXRpYw==","me":{"username":"acc1","_remaining_reports3zrc4S":1}}}}

As you can see in response, "_remaining_reports3zrc4S":1

The response is always 1 for external programs if private program exist or else, it will be null

For eg i have verified that following program are running private program and i am getting response as 1

███████
██████████
████
██████

Where as following program gives me null

██████
███████
██████
████

Also, for some public programs like Security , i get 5 . I am not sure what this remaining report is about but it atleast helps you tell that if external program exist on h1 or not

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Register any sandbox program
  2. Run above graphQL query
  3. If you get "_remaining_reports3zrc4S":1 in response, that means external program is running private program on hackerone
  4. If you get "_remaining_reports3zrc4S":null , that means it doesn't exist on hackerone!

Regards,
Ashish

Impact

Know wether external programs running private programs on hackerone or not

activities.message:
Probably its not mandatory to be a member of sandbox team. 

It depends on user signal i guess. If i test with my account i get everything null, may be because i have 3+ signal. But for my test account (doesn't have any signal), it works and i get above results!

Also, if i query for uber i get 0 from my test account and when i try to submit the report, its not allowing me. So it confirms that it depends on user signal and how many more reports you can submit to a team. The fact that external program not running private program on hackerone doesnt have this signal config set so it always returns null and those who are running it have set the config available at `\signal_settings` and returns some number
activities.markdown_message:
Probably its not mandatory to be a member of sandbox team.

It depends on user signal i guess. If i test with my account i get everything null, may be because i have 3+ signal. But for my test account (doesn't have any signal), it works and i get above results!

Also, if i query for uber i get 0 from my test account and when i try to submit the report, its not allowing me. So it confirms that it depends on user signal and how many more reports you can submit to a team. The fact that external program not running private program on hackerone doesnt have this signal config set so it always returns null and those who are running it have set the config available at \signal_settings and returns some number

activities.message:
So the revised steps would be

1. Create a new user account
2. Run the above graphQL query
3. You should be able to see the results which are posted above

Regards,
Ashish
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks for your report. I don't believe that this is a security vulnerability, unfortunately. The way this is implemented is that it'll only return programs you're actually having access to. When I try to reproduce this, with, let's say `█████`, I'm seeing `null` for my test account (it doesn't have access). Are you sure that your account doesn't have some kind of access to the program? When you've been invited to the program also grants you access. Let me know if you believe I've missed something. Good luck and happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks for your report. I don't believe that this is a security vulnerability, unfortunately. The way this is implemented is that it'll only return programs you're actually having access to. When I try to reproduce this, with, let's say █████, I'm seeing null for my test account (it doesn't have access). Are you sure that your account doesn't have some kind of access to the program? When you've been invited to the program also grants you access. Let me know if you believe I've missed something. Good luck and happy hacking!

activities.message:
Hello @jobert

Does you test account have any signal? my test account doesn't have any signal because i did not submit any reports to any public/private teams!

Thats why i suggested to create a new account. My test account doesnt have any access to ██████, ███████, ██████████ etc but i still get `1` for it. 

As i mentioned, it depends on signal set on `\signal_settings` page by programs. External program  who doesnt have private program returns it null because it doesnt have this page for them if i am not wrong 


Would you mind rechecking from fresh account?


When i say my test account doesnt have any signal, it looks like this

{F297653}



Regards,
Ashish

activities.message: I stand corrected sir, it seems you're right! I was able to reproduce this behavior with a new account. I'll escalate it to the engineering team for someone to check it out. Thanks, might be a nice find!
activities.markdown_message: I stand corrected sir, it seems you're right! I was able to reproduce this behavior with a new account. I'll escalate it to the engineering team for someone to check it out. Thanks, might be a nice find!

activities.message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks again, we'll check this out. We need to verify if this is also returning the remaining reports for external programs that have a program in our sandbox. If that's the case, this isn't as bad as it may look like. However, I'll triage this for now and get back to you soon. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks again, we'll check this out. We need to verify if this is also returning the remaining reports for external programs that have a program in our sandbox. If that's the case, this isn't as bad as it may look like. However, I'll triage this for now and get back to you soon. Thanks!

activities.message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks for your patience. We've determined that with this bug you cannot distinguish a private program from a sandboxed program. That's why there's no impact for us at this moment. However, we want to award you with some cool swag to show our appreciation for the finding. We're planning to get a fix out next week.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks for your patience. We've determined that with this bug you cannot distinguish a private program from a sandboxed program. That's why there's no impact for us at this moment. However, we want to award you with some cool swag to show our appreciation for the finding. We're planning to get a fix out next week.

activities.message: Due to the lack of impact, this report does not meet the minimum requirements to receive a bounty.

activities.message:
Hello @jobert

I think i found a way to find some of the external program having private program. Its not possible for all but atleast you can say about few who has `cover photos`. Sandbox program doesnt have this feature, so whoever has it , has a private program and you can confirm the same using above graphQL query!

In short, If external program has cover photo and it returns remaining report 1 using new account, it has private program because sandbox program doesnt have cover photo feature!

eg
████
███████
█████████
██████



Regards,
Ashish
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @jobert

In short, If external program has cover photo and it returns remaining report 1 using new account, it has private program because sandbox program doesnt have cover photo feature!

eg

██████

Regards,
Ashish

activities.message: Hi, Can you assess the above finding?
activities.markdown_message: Hi, Can you assess the above finding?

activities.message:
Hi @ashish_r_padelkar -

> In short, If external program has cover photo and it returns remaining report 1 using new account, it has private program because sandbox program doesnt have cover photo feature!

We've enabled this for both sandboxed and private programs. This isn't an elaborate method to determine whether they're running a private program. Thanks for checking though, it's appreciated!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ashish_r_padelkar -

In short, If external program has cover photo and it returns remaining report 1 using new account, it has private program because sandbox program doesnt have cover photo feature!

We've enabled this for both sandboxed and private programs. This isn't an elaborate method to determine whether they're running a private program. Thanks for checking though, it's appreciated!

activities.message: Ok, not sure why I can't see cover photo in my test program. I can only see cover color

activities.message: @ashish_r_padelkar It's not enabled by default for everybody. Happy to enable it for your program if you want me to. Just send me your program handle.

activities.message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks for your patience. We just pushed a fix for this! The field will now do a proper authorization check before calculating the number of remaining reports for the given program handle. We'll redact any confidential information in the report soon and request disclosure after that. We're looking forward to receive more reports from you in the future. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @ashish_r_padelkar - thanks for your patience. We just pushed a fix for this! The field will now do a proper authorization check before calculating the number of remaining reports for the given program handle. We'll redact any confidential information in the report soon and request disclosure after that. We're looking forward to receive more reports from you in the future. Happy hacking!
